Author: kartha87#7689
Content: Does anyone have issue with withdrawing eth from from the atomic Dex eth wallet? I am trying to withdraw eth to my binance eth wallet. But the app throws the error, that the address is wrong. Is it a bug?

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: no spaces at start / end?

Author: kartha87#7689
Content: There are No spaces at start / end.

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
@kartha87 can you try to use mixed case address?
e.g. for https://etherscan.io/address/0xa568641f3032c3d2fd83d69215c9ad5971a4cd55 it'll be 0xA568641f3032c3D2Fd83d69215C9AD5971a4Cd55

Author: ca333#0118
Content: @kartha87 atomicDEX mobile uses checksum verification for the ETH address validation. So it is case-sensitive.

Author: kartha87#7689
Content: That's amazing. Thank you. It worked.

Author: kartha87#7689
Content: @ca333  SO are we supposed to enter eth address in a case sensitive manner or will there be an update where the address can be non case sensitive?  Just want to know what is the best practise here?

Author: ca333#0118
Content: @kartha87 we actually updated it the other way around. So first we did allow just raw hex (which represents a ETH address) without further validation but noticed that this could cause issues (users sending to a wrong address) - that is why we implemented https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-55 - to prevent this risk.

Author: ca333#0118
Content: to answer your question: best practise is to use case-sensitive format to prevent the issues and enjoy the benefits described in eip55

Author: kartha87#7689
Content: Got it. Thank you.

Author: Dzy#5475
Content:
Hello there! Thank you for AtomicDEX and all the work you have done so far in Komodo!
I have done swapping some Ricks and Mortys and wanted to try the real deal - sent LTC from Coinbase to AtomicDEX, which went instantly. Here are some observations:
* after the screen locks while being in DEX tab, all the information (coin, amount) resets to blank - I believe it should keep that information after unlocking screen
* the same happens, if I put information in DEX and then switch to Orders or History sub-tab - after coming back to Trade sub-tab, all the fields are blank again
* I like that fiat equivalent is shown, but I would also like to swap coins based on exchange rate (at least informational calculated values shown), not based only on amount
* is it true - if someone has made a market order, I have only two options - either accept the exchange rate or deny it? Is there no option to make market order myself if someone has already done that? 
* What happens with partial orders - for example I want to swap 0.1 BTC to 800 KMD but in the market there is only 400 KMD available for swap?

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: @Dzy the mobile app only does market buy/sells. You would need a desktop app to set limit orders.

Author: Dzy#5475
Content: OK, got it!

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: If you want to try it out, the hyperDEX nightly builds have that functionality right now but is early days and there are some bugs.

Author: Dzy#5475
Content: What about partial order matching? Will it execute partially and the remaining half will stay in the market as my market order for the rest to fill and offer liquidity?

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: Will leave that to atomicDEX support, dont know enough about it to answer with any certainty.

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content:
@Dzy marketmaking is not currently availble through the mobile. There's some notes on doing it via command line (if that's something you're interested in) - https://developers.komodoplatform.com/basic-docs/atomicdex/atomicdex-tutorials/how-to-become-a-liquidity-provider.html

I believe @hyperDEX  and the desktop app will also offer this functionality via GUI in due time.

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: @smk762 -  dracocanis ominator limit orders already work in hyperDEX üòÉ

Author: Dzy#5475
Content:
Thanks, will read about it! Commandline is no problem 
Will look into hyperDEX as well, just couldn`t find the repo initially üòÉ

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: https://github.com/atomiclabs/hyperdex-nightlies/releases/tag/v0.0.0-c2d7531-19.7.27.1745

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: It is a bit hard to find since we dont have a stable release after packaging it with the new mm2.0 backend.

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: It works but there might be little bugs here and there, small crashes, but should work for testing little bits of coins.

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: @Dzy  I added a python wrapper to mm2 here - https://github.com/smk762/pytomicDEX, though it has not been extensively tested and is not 'official', it may be helpful.

Author: mo7881#6408
Content: can someone explains what happens to the balance with a failed or timeout transaction?

Author: mo7881#6408
Content: is it supposed to be retured to sender after a time?

Author: eduard#6056
Content: hello, I have a suggestion for MobileDex, if it is possible.  And if it is possible to install a button to abort the swap as long as it is not completed, as in a normal exchange the trade cancel.

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content:
@mo7881 failed timeout transactions should return after a time, but there is a chance they get stuck. Make sure to NOT clear cache, so we have the data to perform a manual return if required. To do so, DM your logs to a team member (green name - Angelina, Gcharang, TonyL) for review.
@eduard cancelling a trade is possible, but no button exists yet. Depending on what stage of the trade it has progressed to, this may forfeit the dexfee, and require waiting for the trade to timeout. Personally, I'd avoid cancelling a swap once it has begun.

Author: mo7881#6408
Content: @smk762 -  dracocanis ominator I have a few that failed unreturned. Its all small amounts so im not bothered about getting it back but it could help your development.

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
@mo7881 please DM me the log
`Settings -> Send Feedback`

Author: ohweoh#0581
Content: How long does it usually take to add new assets to trade? For insatance Neo or Tezos etc. Is there a priority list for coins to be added as well?

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
@ohweoh AtomicDEX is a GUI
its backend: Marketmaker(mm2) needs to work with any new coin to be added
all the coins tested to work with mm2 have the key-value `mm2: 1` in the file https://github.com/jl777/coins/blob/master/coins

 currently BTC forks and ERC20 can be easily added
Tezos and Neo could be added in the future but no ETA
